defs: = ಯಜಮಾನಿ.
to perform a religious sacrifice.
to conduct religious service to a deity; to worship.
any of the divisions, branches of Yajur Vēda.
one of the four Vedic samhitas, which consists of hymns, used in performing sacrifices, and also of prose.
= ಯಜುರ್ವೇದ.
any of the hymns of Yajurvēda, chanted while performing religious sacrifices.
that part of the Yajurvēda, which consists of only hymns.
an elaborate religious sacrifice.
a religious service; a worshipping.
a difficult, onerous task;ಯಜ್ಞ ಮಾಡು yajña māḍu to perform a religious sacrifice.
to sacrifice an animal; to kill; to slaughter.
to beat heavily and repeatedly; to thrash.
a band of threads wound and tied round the wrist by a person who has undertaken a religious sacrifice.
a pit in the ground where sacrificial fire is maintained and through which sacrificial oblations are offered to gods.
the sacrificial horse which is meant to be sacrificed at the end.
a man who has formally undertaken a religious sacrifice.
an undertaking or commencing of a religious sacrifice.
a ritual observed at this stage.
provisions, equipment, apparatus or furnishing used in or necessary for a religious sacrifice.
the wife of the performer of a sacrifice, who participates with him in the performance.
any of the animal to be sacrificed in a religious sacrifice.
(fig.) a person made to bear the blame for others or to suffer in their place; a scapegoat.
Viṣṇu.
Agni, the fire-God, who is supposed to carry the oblations to the gods.
a person who obstructs the performance of a religious sacrifice; a demon.
a person who has no religion or who does not follow the religious code of conduct.
= ಯಜ್ಞಶಾಲೆ.
the knowledge of conducting religious sacrifices and their effects.
the platform where a religious sacrifice is conducted.
a place where a religious sacrifice is conducted.
= ಯಜ್ಞದ್ರವ್ಯ.
the conducting of a religious sacrifice.
a thread worn over the left shoulder crossing under the right arm, as a symbol of religious initiation; the sacrificial thread.
= ಯಜ್ಞದ್ರವ್ಯ.
= ಯಜ್ಞರಿಪು.
Vīrabhadra, the destroyer of a sacrifice.
Śiva.
= ಯಜ್ಞತುರಗ.
the tree Butea frondosa of Papilionaceae family; flame of the forest.
relating to religious sacrifices.
brought for the purpose of or earmarked for a sacrifice.
fit to be used in a religious sacrifice.
= ಯಜ್ಞದ್ರವ್ಯ.
Viṣṇu.
Indra.
Agni, the Fire-God.
the performance of a religious sacrifice.

worthy of respect, worship.
a religious sacrifice.
a religious service to a deity; worship.
a man who performance a religious sacrifice.
the plant Cocculus hirsutus ( = C. villosus) of Menispermaceae family.
(gram.) a kind of euphonic combination in which 'ಯ, ವ', or 'ರ ' are substituted for a) ಇ, ಈ, b) ಉ, ಊ, and c) ಋ respectively.
lifted up; raised.
stretched forward; held out.
controlled; regulated.
limited; curbed.
the act of running.
the act of urging an elephant by proding the animal with the feet by its driver.
an attempt or effort; a try.

the art of driving, urging an elephant with delicate signs as prodding with the feet.
an expression of opposition, disapproval or dislike; an objection.
a restraining or being restrained; a restraint.
a controlling of one's passions; self-restraint.
(pros.) a pause taken while reading a verse, without affecting the continuity of the intention of the verse.
(mus.) a harmonious musical time or measure embellished with beautifully arranged letters of the lyrics.
(pros.) a breaking of the rules regarding provision of pauses in a verse; an instance of this.

a sage of great merit.
a respectful mode of addressing sages.

speed; swiftness.

to attempt to do; to try.
willingly, zealously trying; indutrious; diligent.

to attempt to do or accomplish; to try; to endeavour.

the letter 'ಯ' (usu. pronounced with the vowel 'ಅ').
as already mentioned.

stubborn or obstinate willfulness, as in pursuing one's own wishes, aims, etc. esp. when in conflict with others; self-will.

disorderly; unsystematically.

any of the religious rituals to be observed daily.
